title: Data Viz Resources
dek: Although we primarily publish visual essays here at The Pudding, we also produce resources for the data journalism and visualization communities.

faq.question: What tools do you use?
faq.answer: This is a multi-part question. Typically, when people ask this, they are asking about the visualization that lives on the internet inside of our stories. Those visuals are most often coded by our team using front-end web languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript). We often rely heavily on the D3.js JavaScript library and Svelte, a component-based framework.

faq.question: What other JavaScript libraries do you use?
li: scrollmagic also for scrollytelling
enter-view to detect when elements enter the screen
d3-annotation for annotations in D3.js
moveto for scrolling to DOM elements
noUiSlider for cross-browser range sliders
lodash for general JS utilities

question: Do you release your data or code?
answer: Yup! Whenever possible, we release our data and data analysis scripts in a GitHub repo for public use.
